intro: Psychotria vesciculifera, commonly known as the blisterleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, waxy leaves that can cause a blistering reaction upon contact with skin. It produces small, white to pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
